Dispute_Type: Discrimination based on color and national/ethnic origin
Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission violated procedural fairness in dismissing the complaint
Evidence_Assessment: Commission reviewed all materials, including new evidence alleged by applicant
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness
Legal_Rule: Under s. 44(3) of the Canadian Human Rights Act, the Commission has discretionary power to accept or reject an investigator's recommendation; procedural fairness requires informing parties of evidence and allowing responses
Procedural_Issue: Allegation of failure to consider new evidence and lack of procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination based on color and national/ethnic origin
Outcome_on_Merits: No violation of procedural fairness; Commission's decision upheld
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application dismissed with costs against the applicant
Review_Standard: Procedural fairness and reasonableness of discretion
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: The investigation was thorough and neutral; parties were informed and allowed to respond
Key_Evidence_Considered: All submitted materials, including applicant's detailed responses
Applicant_Challenge: Commission failed to consider new evidence and acted unfairly
Defendant_Response: Commission acted within its discretionary authority and followed fair procedures
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, investigator's report, applicant submissions
Legal_Provision: s. 44(3) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Claimant_Status: Applicant before the Canadian Human Rights Commission
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 44(3) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Discrimination based on color and national/ethnic origin
Applicable_Process: Complaint investigation and dismissal under the Canadian Human Rights Act
Governing_Rule: s. 44(3), Canadian Human Rights Act; principles of procedural fairness
